alert.note: Alert for Gila; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 17 at 4:14PM MST until July 17 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR GILA AND NAVAJO COUNTIES... At 413 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain had ended across the warned area. However, flooding remains a concern due to earlier rainfall. Between 1.75 and 2.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rainbow City, Fort Apache Reservation and Whiteriver. This includes the following highways... State Route 73 between mile markers 317 and 320...and between mile markers 340 and 349. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... North Fork White River, Cedar Creek, West Cedar Creek, Carrizo Creek, White River, East Cedar Creek, Red Canyon, Diamond Creek, Amos Wash, Bear Canyon, Deer Spring Creek and East Fork White River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
